resources.string: The Reef Life Survey Foundation (RLS) is a non-profit environmental organisation that makes the underwater world visible – to scientists, governments, artists and anyone with an interest in rocky and coral reefs around the world and how these reefs are changing./n/n Reef Life Survey relies on the skills and dedication of recreational SCUBA divers using the same detailed methodology to record the abundance of all conspicuous species observed on reefs. Since 2008, this RLS methodology has been used to survey over 3000 reefs across more than 50 countries spanning every continent in the world (including Antarctica!)./n/n Working collaboratively with government and management agencies, professional scientists and recreational divers, RLS aims to use this high-quality temporal and spatial information on the condition of reefs to improve biodiversity conservation and the sustainable management of marine resources.
This app was created by Jason Ludden and has been released as fully open-source on Github

This application would not be possible without the following Android libraries. In addition, special thanks to Nick Butcher and the Plaid application, as well as Google Android Architecture Blueprints
